Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist for our client in pharma.




Tasks:

Assist in Migration of data science application "CTR Portal" from Domino to the ASAPS platform,
Modify data stream from Metabolite readers (an analytical instrument called RapidPoint 500e),
Help in migrating database type from sqlite3 to Postgres where it is used across the Cell Therapy IT infrastructure.




Required skils:

Streamlit,
Postfres,
Python,
Git,
Docker setups,
Virtual machines (Linux).




Start date: 20.01.2025

End date: 19.10.2025

Location: Måløv

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Research Scientist for Product and Process Development agile team family, Solid Products Development & Innovation, Novonesis

Join us as our new Research Scientist

Are you eager to try out your talent and ambitions developing innovative products and processes in Novonesis’ largest formulation pilot plant?

In Product and Process development we have the responsibility to make the products and processes for our worldwide production sites. You will be in a cross-functional agile team (with members of fermentation, recovery, and formulation) with a primary focus to create new biosolutions that excite our customers. Your role will be to develop and scale-up new solid enzyme/protein products and processes to production scale, assisted by product/process models and other digital tools that you will build. To succeed you will combine insights of digitalization, enzymes/proteins, and powder processes (e.g. granulation, spray drying, fluid bed processing), and together with your agile team you will select the optimal solutions both for customer value and product quality. You will be in direct contact with our colleagues in marketing, production, pilot plants, application, and other R&D departments in Novonesis as well as external customers. You will drive results on your own and together with other highly skilled scientists and pilot/lab technicians.

Welcome to Solid Products Development & Innovation (SPDI)

We are part of Formulation Development, where we are responsible for development of enzyme and other protein products and production processes, upscaling of new products and technologies, as well as supporting and improving our existing product range. In SPDI, we are a team of 15 highly engaged, multicultural scientists, with a passion for enzyme formulation, solids processing, and product innovation. We cooperate with many of Novonesis’ functions locally and internationally.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Developing and optimizing solid formulations and processes with focus on quality, stability, and optimal format for the final commercial products
Improving the way we work by driving digital transformation in the department, developing product/process models and other tools, such as Python-based apps
Working independently as well as taking the responsibility as project leader and as a team player, contributing to a high performing cross-functional Agile Team
Supporting customers, doing production troubleshooting, and scaling up to our global production plants


To Succeed You Must


Have a MSc degree in chemical or biochemical engineering, preferentially combined with a PhD
Have experience with first-principles or mechanistic modelling and data-driven decision making and be familiar with a programming language such as Python/Matlab/R
Be independent with strong personal drive, while enjoying collaboration and communication with different stakeholders
Have experience within solids processing, e.g. spray drying, fluid bed processing, granulation or similar process technologies is an advantage
Enjoy project management and taking a role as project leader
Have experience with planning and executing experiments and enjoy day to day collaboration with highly skilled pilot and laboratory technicians


Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Location: Bagsvaerd, Copenhagen, Denmark

Application deadline: 19-01-2025

Contact details: Kåre Jørgensen Engsted, Head of Solid Products Development and Innovation, KJQE@novonesis.com

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.


Please attach a cover letter to your application explaining your motivation for applying for this job.


To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Also, please attach your transcripts from undergraduate and postgraduate (if applicable) studies.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Ready to Make an Impact? Be Our Machine Learning Engineer!

Do you have the talent and potential to develop machine learning applications for market leading food processing equipment?

We are expanding our activities within machine learning for our highly advanced processing equipment for the food industry. Therefore, we are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer with a good background in software development, that can contribute to the development and implementation of new and existing machine learning applications at Marel.

As Machine Learning Engineer, you will be a part of a professional software engineering team, and work closely with our skilled Software and Computer Vision Engineers. We are on a journey with development of machine learning solutions and you will play a central role in ensuring that Marel continues to lead the global market.

Marel is the global leader in transforming the way food is processed. Our core competences are within our advanced software and full line integration, and therefore we are building on a strong technical platform, which enables us to develop, integrate and service our products with the highest performance for our customers.

In The Position You Will


Be part of a team that is leading the buildup of machine learning and AI competencies within the organization.
Be a part of building and maintain Marel’s AI computer vision platform solutions.
Work closely together with other innovation teams on a global level on machine learning solutions.
Be responsible for development work together with our innovation teams.
Investigate and incorporate new and existing technologies into our technology stack.
Collect, consolidate and challenge the requirements from stakeholders.
You will focus on supporting solutions for the development teams in industry Fish, Meat and Poultry. You will work closely with your colleges in technical centers in Garðabær (Iceland), Aarhus & Støvring (Denmark) and Boxmeer (the Netherlands).


What’s in It for You?

Experience the satisfaction of doing something worthwhile for a living. At Marel, you can expect:


The freedom to take initiative and make a real impact in a growing global business.
Recognition for your achievements.
Clear objectives and realistic demands.
Access to decision-makers and a global network of specialists.
Space to explore and learn.


What Kind of Person Are You?

Qualifications

At Marel, we encourage our 7,500+ employees to bring their unique selves to work. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture where everyone feels recognized, valued, and free to explore their potential. To succeed in this role, you’ll need:


We expect you to be curious, communicating and have a desire for gaining new knowledge, in order to build Marel’s machine learning competencies.
You have a Master's degree in Engineering or Computer Science with a focus on machine learning, data analysis, and/or artificial intelligence.
You are proficient working in Linux.
You are able to work effectively in multi-disciplinary teams.
Are result-driven with good analytical skills.
Innovative thinking and eagerness to solve known problems with new approaches.
Proficient English skills.


It will be an advantage if you have experience within software development using Python, C++, JavaScript, HTML, Computer vision, and Cloud Platforms but it is not required. An additional bonus is if you are familiar with ML Ops way of working, embedded and/or real-time systems.

Ready to Join Us?

If you’re ready to find true meaning in your work, this might be the right role for you. Please send us your application in English through our website no later than January 15th, 2025.

For any questions, please contact our Talent Acquisition Specialist, Hildur Halldórsdóttir, at hildur.halldorsdottir@marel.com.

Learn more about Marel: Visit our website

Follow us on LinkedIn: Marel: Overview | LinkedIn

Title: Data Scientist med passion for data og fremtidens energiløsninger
Description:
Vil du være med til at forme fremtidens energi-infrastruktur ved hjælp af data og avancerede prognoser? Hos Fellowmind søger vi en Data Scientist, der kan forvandle data til værdifulde indsigter og hjælpe os med at forudsige morgendagens udfordringer og muligheder inden for den grønne omstilling, øget elektrificering og kapacitet.

Din rolle i Energy & Utility teamet

Som Data Scientist hos os bliver du en del af et innovativt og ambitiøst team, der arbejder målrettet med at skabe datadrevne og intelligente løsninger til branchen. Din opgave bliver at konsolidere og modellere store mængder data og identificere mønstre og sammenhænge, som kan hjælpe os og vores kunder med at træffe bedre beslutninger om net-planlægning og -udbygning samt identificere uregelmæssigheder og fejl før de opstår.

Du vil arbejde med store mængder data og derudfra bygge avancerede modeller, der kan forudsige kapacitetsudfordringer og besvare spørgsmål som: Hvor vil der opstå behov for nye ladestandere? Hvordan påvirker hele boligområders overgang til elbiler vores elnet? Og hvordan kan vi bedst planlægge udbygning og vedligeholdelse af infrastrukturen baseret på historiske data og fremtidige prognoser?

Dine ansvarsområder:


Udførende i at skabe værdifulde indsigter fra data, også med udvikling af AI/ML-funktioner til datadrevne og intelligente løsninger.
Udvikle og implementere modeller til at forudsige fremtidige energibehov baseret på data fra de seneste år, på forskellige områder.
Muliggøre analyse af eksempelvis belastningen på elnettet og danne grundlag for løsninger til at imødekomme kapacitetsudfordringer.
Identificere og genkende mønstre i komplekse datasæt for at skabe operationelle anbefalinger.
Arbejde med scenarieanalyse og "what-if"-problemstillinger
Skabe grundlag for indsigt og forudsigelser, der hjælper vores kunder med at navigere i deres investeringer i fremtidens energiløsninger.



Hvem er du?

Vi forestiller os, at du har en stærk baggrund inden for dataanalyse og modellering. Du har måske en uddannelse i fysik, matematik eller data engineering, data science og forstår komplekse energidomæner. Du er god til at arbejde med data og kan hurtigt lære nye teknologier og værktøjer. Hvis du har erfaring med at arbejde med store datasæt og interesse for energisektoren er det et stort plus.

Du er skarp i kommunikation og formår at formidle komplekse "findings" i et letforståeligt sprog.

Rent teknisk forestiller vi os at du har flere af følgende egenskaber:


Er knivskarp til SQL og forstår relationelle data helt ud til fingerspidserne.
Praktisk erfaring med Machine Learning og udvikling af funktionelle AI/ML løsninger.
Praktisk erfaring med MLOPs (Machine Learning Operations).
Har erfaring med Databricks, Data Factory og Data Lake eller tilsvarende teknologier.
DevOps-processer/pipelines og relaterede cloudtjenester/teknologier til udrulning af ML-løsninger.



Om din kommende arbejdsplads:

Fellowmind er et landsdækkende og førende IT-konsulenthus og samtidig landets mest prisvindende Microsoft-partner med mere en 15 års branche fokus på energi- og forsyning. Med dybe spidskompetencer og målrettede løsninger er vi aktiv medspiller i at drive den grønne omstilling ved hjælp af data. Som ny kollega i Fellowmind vil du møde en organisation, der ikke kun tillader, men tilskynder personlig og faglig udvikling, hvorfor selve arbejdsmiljøet også i høj grad bærer præg af tillid, nysgerrighed og respekt alle kollegaer imellem.

Vi tror på at arbejdsglæde og trivsel er fundamentet for både glade kollegaer og høj kundetilfredshed. Vi tilbyder derfor bl.a. en fleksibel arbejdsplads, hvor du har friheden til at tilpasse din arbejdstid efter dine behov. Vi har stor tillid til, at du selv kender de rammer, der får dig til at trives. Vi synes dog selv, at det er vigtigst at fremhæve, at du får et stærkt team, der støtter dig hele vejen, og du kommer til at indgå i en fed virksomheds kultur.

Såfremt du har nogle spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Rekrutteringskonsulent, Mathias på +45 2332 4290.
Show more

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Go Autonomous

Go Autonomous is at the forefront of B2B innovation. Go Autonomous introduces the new way enterprises communicate, transact, and work. Our solution suite brings transformative experiences and unprecedented efficiency gains to our customers' commercial operations. Simply put, we are building the future of B2B commerce - Autonomous Commerce.

Go Autonomous is trusted by key industrial players in Denmark and abroad. Our headquarters are in the heart of Copenhagen, and amazing colleagues from 15+ countries look forward to meeting you!

To accelerate our expansion, Go Autonomous is actively seeking a Demand Generation Specialist to join the marketing team in Copenhagen. 




Your Team’s Mission

Are you passionate about technology and excited about creating seamless solutions that connect systems and bring value to customers? Join our Customer Integration Team as a Junior Software Engineer and grow your career while impacting our customers’ success.

Who are we?

We’re a dynamic and supportive team dedicated to integrating our systems with those of our customers to deliver exceptional experiences. We value collaboration, innovation, and a customer-first mindset. As part of our team, you’ll have the chance to learn, grow, and contribute meaningfully.

What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with the Customer Integration Team to design, develop, and maintain integration solutions using .NET C#.
Participate in our agile development cycle
Work closely with customers to understand their needs and ensure our integrations exceed expectations.
Participate in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues to provide smooth and reliable experiences for our customers.
Write clean, well-tested, and well-documented code that meets high-quality standards.
Learn and apply best practices for software development and integration projects.

Who You Are:

You have a solid foundation in an object-oriented programming language (we primarily use .NET C#).
You’re eager to learn and grow your skills.
You find joy in pushing well-tested and documented solutions to production.
You’re passionate about creating solutions that make a difference for customers.
You have strong communication skills and are comfortable engaging with customers and teammates alike.
You could see yourself as an experience maker - just like every other member of the Go Family.

Why Join Us?

Opportunity to grow your career as a developer in a supportive and collaborative environment.
Work on impactful projects that directly enhance customer experiences.
Work with the newest technologies in an AI company.
Be part of a culture that values innovation, teamwork, and continuous improvement.
Enjoy being part of a team that’s passionate about technology and creating meaningful solutions.




In return for your magic, we offer:
Pension. We care about your future.
Insurance. We care about you today.
Mental health support. We care about your well-being now.
Warrants program. You are welcome to join the club.
Internet and phone coverage. This is a human right.
Central location. Easy public transport access and friendly workplace.
Lunch, coffee, snacks, and a Friday bar.
Social gatherings and fun activities. You can also start your interest club as well.




We urge you to apply for any of our positions, even if your qualifications do not perfectly match.

We invite individuals with various perspectives and experiences to join us, as these contributions frequently surpass the usual job expectations, fostering an environment rich in continuous education. Should you be eager to become part of a rapidly expanding company at the forefront of digital innovation for the globe's most progressive firms, we urge you to submit your application for any of our positions, even if your qualifications do not perfectly align.

Show more
HTML:
About Go Autonomous

Go Autonomous is at the forefront of B2B innovation. Go Autonomous introduces the new way enterprises communicate, transact, and work. Our solution suite brings transformative experiences and unprecedented efficiency gains to our customers' commercial operations. Simply put, we are building the future of B2B commerce - Autonomous Commerce.

Go Autonomous is trusted by key industrial players in Denmark and abroad. Our headquarters are in the heart of Copenhagen, and amazing colleagues from 15+ countries look forward to meeting you!

To accelerate our expansion, Go Autonomous is actively seeking a Demand Generation Specialist to join the marketing team in Copenhagen. 


Your Team’s Mission

Are you passionate about technology and excited about creating seamless solutions that connect systems and bring value to customers? Join our Customer Integration Team as a Junior Software Engineer and grow your career while impacting our customers’ success.

Who are we?

We’re a dynamic and supportive team dedicated to integrating our systems with those of our customers to deliver exceptional experiences. We value collaboration, innovation, and a customer-first mindset. As part of our team, you’ll have the chance to learn, grow, and contribute meaningfully.

What You’ll Do:

  • Collaborate with the Customer Integration Team to design, develop, and maintain integration solutions using .NET C#.
  • Participate in our agile development cycle
  • Work closely with customers to understand their needs and ensure our integrations exceed expectations.
  • Participate in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues to provide smooth and reliable experiences for our customers.
  • Write clean, well-tested, and well-documented code that meets high-quality standards.
  • Learn and apply best practices for software development and integration projects.

Who You Are:

  • You have a solid foundation in an object-oriented programming language (we primarily use .NET C#).
  • You’re eager to learn and grow your skills.
  • You find joy in pushing well-tested and documented solutions to production.
  • You’re passionate about creating solutions that make a difference for customers.
  • You have strong communication skills and are comfortable engaging with customers and teammates alike.
  • You could see yourself as an experience maker - just like every other member of the Go Family.

Why Join Us?

  • Opportunity to grow your career as a developer in a supportive and collaborative environment.
  • Work on impactful projects that directly enhance customer experiences.
  • Work with the newest technologies in an AI company.
  • Be part of a culture that values innovation, teamwork, and continuous improvement.
  • Enjoy being part of a team that’s passionate about technology and creating meaningful solutions.


In return for your magic, we offer:
  • Pension. We care about your future.
  • Insurance. We care about you today.
  • Mental health support. We care about your well-being now.
  • Warrants program. You are welcome to join the club.
  • Internet and phone coverage. This is a human right.
  • Central location. Easy public transport access and friendly workplace.
  • Lunch, coffee, snacks, and a Friday bar.
  • Social gatherings and fun activities. You can also start your interest club as well.


We urge you to apply for any of our positions, even if your qualifications do not perfectly match.

We invite individuals with various perspectives and experiences to join us, as these contributions frequently surpass the usual job expectations, fostering an environment rich in continuous education. Should you be eager to become part of a rapidly expanding company at the forefront of digital innovation for the globe's most progressive firms, we urge you to submit your application for any of our positions, even if your qualifications do not perfectly align.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
BLAST is growing rapidly and we are looking to push the limits of technology even further in order to deliver the best experience for our fans all over the world - from large-scale stadium events to intimate studio experiences.

We are looking for a software engineer to help us build reliable and high performance systems for our events. Our team focuses on developing a very wide array of systems - often related to integration with the different games we do. This involves everything from game statistics processing to real-time data visualizations (such as game HUDs, broadcast graphics or stage visuals/automations) and tools used by our production team.

There are always projects coming in, but we also encourage taking time to explore and learn new things. Our goal is to always look for new ways to use technology and constantly push the boundaries of what is possible.

Most of our systems run on-site in our studios or at our live events all over the world - some of which you will be attending to ensure successful delivery and troubleshoot any potential issues.

The team

You will be working in a small engineering team where everyone has a voice throughout the entire process - from ideation together with our product teams to what technologies and architecture we should use. There are often new projects to work on, which also means workdays will be very varied.

You will have frequent 1:1s with your manager, through which you will be able to work on your personal development and growth, by setting clear goals and getting, as well as providing, direct and actionable feedback.

Our culture is very informal where everyone is involved in planning and executing. We value the input of everyone and are not afraid of having discussions on everything from high-level ideas to what technologies we should use. We always want to improve and learn new things, and want you to always share your opinion. While we do run quickly, our main objective is that everyone enjoys being part of the team at BLAST

We also offer


An opportunity to help build a variety of new products
A varied workday with a team of awesome colleagues
Time to innovate and research technologies and learn new things
Picking your own high-end equipment and accessories



Requirements


Relevant degree (eg. Computer Science or Engineering) or equivalent experience
Curious, quick learner and eager to master new technologies
Experience with modern JavaScript
Ability to work at our office in Copenhagen
Ability to travel to and work at events


Responsibilities


Help build innovative solutions for our events
Take part in planning and scoping of deliveries
Perform setup, troubleshooting and debugging at events
Help drive innovation across our projects as well as how we build software
Take part in creating an engaging working environment


Bonus points


Experience with TypeScript and frontend frameworks (eg. Vue, React, Angular)
Familiarity with live broadcasting and equipment
Experience working at live events
Interest in esports



Benefits


Competitive salary package
Enhanced parental leave
Pension and Health Insurance
Awesome new office in the centre of Copenhagen
Team building and social events
Lunch, snacks and sodas
Company trips (2024 we all went to Barcelona and had a BLAST)
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Please be aware that response times may be longer due to Christmas holidays.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Frontend Developer
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join us on an exceptional growth journey with massive social impact? Are you a skilled and curious frontend developer who cares about your craft and user impact? And does working with passionate tech colleagues on one of the Nordic's most purpose-strong consumer apps excite you? Then we have just the job for you!

Tiimo is a daily planner and learning platform designed by and for neurodivergent individuals (people with ADHD, Autism, dyslexia, OCD). 20% of the global population (1.6 billion people) is estimated to be neurodivergent and often struggle living meaningful lives. 30-40% of neurodivergent individuals are unemployed, 80% of adults with ADHD will suffer from depression or anxiety and two out of three autistic adults will have considered suicide. Tiimo is changing that!

We are based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Our culture thrives on empathy, ambition and making a real difference. Tiimo has more than 500,000 users worldwide and +50K app downloads per month. Tiimo was nominated as a finalist for an Apple Design Award in the Inclusion category during the summer of 2024, which recognizes apps that use technology to promote inclusion across races, genders, disabilities, and more.

As our frontend developer, you need to be an excellent and hands-on developer and a team player. You will be developing for cross-platform, in particular our web app and future Android app, using Next.js and React Native. Together the rest of our developers and designer, you will be building new fantastic product features. We are building everything in-house, and you will be a part of a great, friendly and ambitious 10-person strong and CPH-based Tech and Product team.

In this role, you will…


Develop and maintain our new PWA that is built upon Next.js
Develop our future Android app that is built using React Native, from the same codebase using Solito
Collaborate with design and the product team to create user-friendly interfaces
Optimize application performance for both mobile and web platforms
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in Next.js and React Native development.


You will be a great fit if...


You are an experienced frontend developer who knows the craft of building beautiful and user-friendly interfaces for cross-platforms using Next.js and React Native.
You’re committed to write clean, scalable and maintainable code.
You’re good at breaking down designs into clear development tasks.
You are purpose passionate. At Tiimo we are passionate about making a difference for an underserved neurodiverse community and hope that you share this passion with us.
You are a detail-oriented problem-solver with good communication skills. We need you to own your own domain and assist in refining new features for our products and we believe that building great software requires great communication and compassion.
You thrive in an international and inclusive environment. We are a team from many different nationalities. English is our working language.
You have security and stability at the front of your mind.
You enjoy using modern work tools. Linear for issue tracking, Github, Xcode Cloud and Azure DevOps as source control, Sentry and Firebase for error reporting, Mixpanel/Metabase for analytics, Slack for internal communication, Figma for design, and Notion as a knowledge base.
We would love it if you also have experience in:
Experience with CI/CD Pipelines
Experience with unit/integration tests
Experience from similar sized startup/scaleup

The key components of our stack includes…


Tamagui
Solito for cross-platform navigation
Next.js
Expo SDK
Expo Router


Other very important benefits and things to take note of 😃


Flexibility! We’re all wired differently and our needs are not all the same
As much responsibility as you want and help from an experienced team who loves working together 💪🏽
Hands on experience designing for an app that reaches thousands of wonderful users around the world and has a major impact on people’s wellbeing 🧡
Diversity, equality and inclusion are important to us. Meanwhile, you must have the right to work within the EU, sadly we will not be able to support applicants in gaining a work permit.


How to apply

Simply follow the one-click application process and share your Linkedin profile with us. We prefer to keep things uncomplicated for now and get to know the real you in the face2face part of the interview process.

The deadline to apply is midnight on January 12th 2025. We are continuously reviewing applications, so hit the apply button now if you don’t want to miss out on this opportunity!

We will get in touch with successful applicants for the next round, which will involve a task, followed by a short interview. If you have any questions about the job, you are welcome to contact us.

We can’t wait to see the impact you will make at Tiimo, not just in our product, but in the lives of millions around the world.

All the best, Team Tiimo

Title: Software Engineer (Data Engineering)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who are we?

At Resolve, we are redefining how companies manage and resolve complex technology issues. We provide innovative solutions that streamline and automate the decision-making process for advertisers, helping them tackle challenges with confidence and speed. By combining cutting-edge AI, advanced analytics, and expert insights, we empower organisations to optimize their technology infrastructure and drive business success.




Check out our website: https://resolve.tech/




We are part of the global WPP network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.




About the role and what you will do:

As our new Software Engineer, you will join our growing CTV team. Here, you will provide expertise in building and maintaining scalable data pipelines, ETL processes, and data infrastructure.




More specifically, your day-to-day will look like:

Implement robust, scalable data pipelines using Apache Spark, Python, and Argo Workflows to process large volumes of data efficiently.
Support and enhance workflow automation using Kubernetes-native tools, ensuring reliable execution of data processing tasks.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate solutions.
Contribute to automated testing strategies for data pipelines and maintain code quality standards.
Monitor data pipeline performance and assist in troubleshooting and optimisation.




What you will bring

Experience with Python in a data engineering role
Experience with Apache Spark and familiarity with workflow orchestration tools like Argo Workflows
Working knowledge of data warehousing concepts and cloud platforms (AWS/GCP)
Experience with version control systems (Git) and CI/CD practices
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams




Inclusion & how you'll work:

We actively encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and are committed to providing a fair and equitable recruitment process. If you require any adjustments or support during the application or interview process, please let your recruiter know as early as possible, and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.




We embrace a hybrid working model, balancing time between our vibrant office spaces and the flexibility of remote work. You'll have more details on how hybrid working applies to your specific role later in the recruitment process.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
As the Lead Data Scientist at Grundfos, your primary responsibility will be to lead the data science component of multiple projects. These projects will involve extracting valuable insights and developing AI/ML features for the company's digital products and solutions. You will have a combination of hands-on tasks and leadership responsibilities as we introduce an AI-powered portfolio to the market.

What is the job about?

Your daily interactions as a professional at Grundfos require effective communication skills, as you collaborate with various stakeholders such as business owners, technical experts, and employees from diverse backgrounds. It is important for you to prioritize projects correctly and provide clarity on the necessary steps for a successful digital future. One of your key responsibilities will be to ensure that projects are prepared for adaptability to new solutions, with a focus on achieving end-to-end readiness.

As part of the AI Solutions department within Grundfos' Digital Development, you will join a highly skilled team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers. Together, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's digital transformation agenda by actively working towards implementing advanced analytics and AI capabilities into Grundfos' digital products and solutions, actively contributing to the company's digital service portfolio evolution.

Additionally, you will have the opportunity to guide and mentor junior data scientists, assisting them in developing effective AI/ML solutions for different projects. These projects will address crucial areas such as monitoring and optimizing water systems, enhancing energy efficiency in pumping applications, detecting anomalies in IoT data, and creating predictive maintenance solutions for pumping systems.

Your main responsibilities:


Working with machine learning and advancing statistical procedures in different projects for obtaining actionable insights and development of relevant AI/ML features for Grundfos digital products and solutions.
Guide junior and senior data scientist
Working with both development and deployment of data science processes integrated with our Data and AI platforms.
Suggesting, scoping, and formulating data-driven projects based on business's interests.
Active communication with relevant stakeholders and discussion about potential AI/ML based solutions for different business sectors.
Staying informed about recent updates and developments in Data Science field for improving the results of data science projects.
Leading, with the unit manager, the analytics and AI roadmap of digital products in collaboration with relevant business stakeholders in divisions


Your background:

We imagine that you have:


Advanced degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.
Extensive experience of using statistical and mathematical modelling based on IOT data in cloud or edge including timeseries analysis/forecasting, optimization techniques, and various supervised/unsupervised machine learning methods. It is an advantage also if you have previous experience of working with video, image, and audio data.
At least five years of experience in a similar position.
Proficiency in python
In-depth understanding of data models and data management
It is an advantage if you have practical experience with MLOPs (Machine Learning Operations), DevOps process/pipelines and related cloud services/technologies for deployment of ML solutions (e.g., MLflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure ML, Snowflake, etc.).
Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams and active communication with different stakeholders from program managers, product owners, UI/UX developers, R&D researchers, testers, application experts, system architectures and sales and service colleagues.
Good communicational skills in English in both speech and writing.
Good soft skills such as excellent in presentation and visualization, quick learner in new business domain, making complex information easy to understand, communicate at different levels such as software developers, manager, business owners, and tech specialists.


What’s in it for you?

Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values.

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:


We encourage you to be at the offices, where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues. If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation
On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice
Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes
Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development
Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly


Do you want to learn more?

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.

  • On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice
  • Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes
  • Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development
  • Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly

Do you want to learn more?

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

As a Data Scientist – Platform Intelligence at Cint, reporting to the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will provide insights to support the development of new products, enhance the performance of existing ones, and deliver data-driven product solutions in collaboration with product and engineering teams.

You will also be working with Commercial, Operations, and Finance teams to understand, analyze, explain, and predict the impact of platform algorithms on clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, predictive understanding of marketplace dynamics, including price elasticity and demand/supply balance, and their underlying mechanics.
Support ad-hoc requests from stakeholders by conducting exploratory analyses to deepen insights into metrics and trends. Perform A/B testing and other experiments as needed.
Define statistical and machine learning methods, establish modeling standards, and drive their development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new and existing products.
Create clear, effective deliverables that communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations tailored to diverse audiences.


Qualifications

What We Are Looking For


Minimum 2+ years of solid experience in a data science role.
Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research, or a related quantitative field.
Strong ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
In-depth understanding of statistical techniques and concepts (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression, predictive modeling).
Solid knowledge of machine learning techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, decision trees) and their practical applications and limitations.
Experience applying statistical and modeling techniques in real-world scenarios.
Proficient in Python (for statistical and ML tools).
Proficient in SQL and handling large-scale databases.
Comfortable researching and adopting new methods, tools, and techniques


Essential Qualities


Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner, motivated to deliver results
Data driven with the ability to translate abstract requests into actionable initiatives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain and defend analytical techniques to non-experts
Ability to understand the big picture while ensuring attention to detai


Additional Information

Bonus Points If You Have


Experience with online market research methods/products
Experience in Identity graph methodologies
Experience with Identity vendors
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark)


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Scientist, Trust & Safety
Description:
Bumble is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and play a key role in fulfilling our mission to create a world where all relationships are healthy and equitable. Concretely, this means exploring our large datasets, developing statistical models and designing data-driven strategies for products that provide a safe and engaging experience for our users, and improve the way Bumble operates.

With billions of collected data points and millions of images and messages exchanged on our platform every day, there is a wealth of opportunity to make a real difference in this role and help people to find love all over the world! The ideal candidate combines strong business acumen, extensive experience in data science and advanced analytics along with a background in trust & safety.

Trust & Safety

We are part of the Trust & Safety Engineering group, a cross-functional team of 40+  engineers, scientists and machine learning professionals that help grow kind, healthy & equitable connections by designing and operationalizing the safest and most trusted connections platform in the industry.  We partner with the wider business to create and share tooling, knowledge, and best practices around Trust and Safety technology while undertaking special product and development initiatives designed to improve the actual safety and felt experience of safety of members across our products. We’re known by the wider industry as experts in our field, and give back to the community through thought leadership, information sharing, and open-sourcing.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Work in a cross-functional team alongside data scientists and machine learning engineers
Analyse large sets of data and work closely with Safety Product Management to educate roadmaps and define key metrics, aligning them with Bumble Inc's goals
Identify areas of maximum value and contribute to setting up frameworks for evaluating algorithmic improvements. 
Initiate and conduct large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development
Partner effectively with business functions and engineering teams to translate problems into scalable AI solutions, leveraging the richness of our extensive and intricate datasets
Foster a culture of insightful storytelling across our Group and the business, emphasising collaboration and connection within the team. Your style is characterised by empathy, open communication, and a commitment to promoting diversity and inclusion





WE’D LOVE TO MEET SOMEONE WITH
Strong statistical modelling background - hypotheses testing, inference, regressions, random variables
Comfortable presenting back to technical and non-technical stakeholders through effective data visualisation and building of reporting frameworks
Comfortable with Python data science libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, statsmodels
Strong SQL experience including analytic functions, performance tuning, data wrangling
Ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to combine business intuition with the application of advanced solutions
A passion for keeping up with the latest ongoings in Data Science and Machine Learning communities
A curious mind, self-starter and endlessly keen to learn and develop themselves professionally





AN ADDED BONUS IF YOU HAVE
A proven background in trust & safety or experience of working in a similar role
An understanding of multi-sided markets and/or dating problem space
Experience in using advanced statistical methods to solve problems. This can either be through academic projects and publications, or experience analysing and solving problems within industry
Understanding of Machine Learning development lifecycle
A basic knowledge of software development life cycle processes and tools - ETL pipelines, CI/CD, MLOps, agile methodologies, version control (git), testing frameworks 





Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist



Salary: £60k - £80k plus bonus and benefits



Location: London - Hybrid



Data Idols are proud to partner with a renowned tech giant as they continue to push the boundaries of innovation. We are assisting them in expanding their data capabilities by hiring an experienced and driven Data Scientist. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking organisation at the forefront of technology, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping data-driven strategies and solutions that make a real impact.






The Opportunity



As a Data Scientist, you will:

Dive into large datasets to extract meaningful insights and identify trends that drive strategic decision-making.
Develop and refine predictive models and machine learning algorithms to address complex business challenges.
Partner with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, analysts, and product managers, to design and implement impactful data-driven solutions.
Transform complex findings into clear, compelling visualisations and reports that resonate with stakeholders at all levels.
Stay at the cutting edge of data science by exploring emerging technologies and methodologies, bringing fresh ideas and innovative approaches to the team.






What's in it for you?




Private pension scheme
Generous annual leave
Flexible/hybrid working options
Comprehensive training and development opportunities
Career progression in a supportive environment


Skills and Experience


Proven experience in data science, including machine learning and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Strong SQL skills for data manipulation and querying.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, we'd love to hear from you! Please send your CV by clicking the "Apply" button below.



Data Scientist


Desired Skills and Experience

Python|SQL

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Summary

NHS Resolution is a not-for-profit part of the NHS working for health care providers to resolve claims fairly and to share learning across the NHS and beyond. We provide a supportive environment for our staff with specialist training and the opportunity for personal development.

Reporting to the Data Science Manager, the post holder will provide expertise in Data Science and analytical methods. The post holder will assist the data science team in development of statistical and analytical best practices and apply these practices to complex NHSR datasets to deliver data insights.

The post holder will develop data science methodologies for ad-hoc analysis, insights work and for highly complex prediction and statistical models. The person will also contribute to model testing and development activities performed by the data science team.

Main duties of the job

Please see the attached Job description and Person specification for more information.

Act as an expert for the organisation on Data Science methods and analytical methods.

Develop statistical and analytical best practices and apply the best practices to complex NHSR datasets to deliver data insights.

Research and develop methodologies for the implementation of highly complex prediction and statistical models.

Contribute to model testing and development activities performed by the data science team and contribute to deploying data catalogue to create a consistent, managed pool of data assets.

Contribute to the development of statistical, mathematical and predictive modelling for such highly complex issues as claim value prediction.

Aid in the design of machine learning models to identify risk patterns to drive intelligently NHSR activity such as scenario modelling around risk and payout. Project length 3 years.

Assist in granular analysis of each stage of the claims lifecycle to drive changes in the claim processing, improve training, improve data quality and optimize NHSR resource allocation.

About Us

NHS Resolution is an Arms Length Body of the Department of Health & Social Care. As a not for profit part of the NHS, our purpose is to provide expertise to the NHS to resolve concerns fairly, share learning for improvement and preserve resources for patients. We have four key service areas:


Claims Management: delivering expertise in handling clinical and non-clinical claims to members of our Indemnity Schemes.
Practitioner Performance Advice: providing advice, support and interventions in relation to concerns about the individual performance of Doctors, Dentists and Pharmacists.
Primary Care Appeals: offering an impartial tribunal service for the fair handling of Primary Care contracting services.
Safety and Learning: supporting the NHS to better understand and learn from claims, concerns and disputes; to target safety activity while sharing learning across the NHS.


What do we have to offer?

At NHS Resolution, we strive to be an employer of choice. Some of the benefits we offer include access to the NHS Pension Scheme and a minimum of 27 days Annual Leave. We are also committed to support individuals in having a work and life balance, offering flexible working arrangements. Furthermore, we can offer a chance to gain extra skills and training and with regular reviews and a clear plan, all employees can develop to their full potential.

Job Description

Job responsibilities

Please ensure that you read the job description carefully and that you address each of the requirements of the post in the person specification in your supporting statement sections as your application will be assessed against these criteria. Your online application should relate to the specific position you are applying for and you are expected to highlight examples and achievements that demonstrate the competencies outlined in the job description and from the vacancy notice in your application form. Try to keep it structured and to the point.

Please note that we do not accept CVs, therefore your application must be via the NHS Jobs online application form. We have been granted permission to use the Employment Service's "Positive about Disabled People" symbol. Any applicant with a disability who meets the minimum specification for the post as set out in the person specification is guaranteed an interview.

We reserve the right to close the advert early should we receive sufficient applications

Please note: If you require a Visa to work in the UK, NHS Resolution is currently unable to support any sponsorship requests.

Person Specification

Notice Period Essential


What is your current notice period? Please add your notice length and comment if your notice period is negotiable.


Qualifications Essential


Educated to masters degree level or equivalent relevant experience.


Experience Essential


Ability to demonstrate significant experience within a similar area of work.
Considerable experience of using machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, classification, and NLP).
Experience in at least one cloud platform (preferably Azure) and associated machine learning services, e.g. Azure ML.


Supporting Statement Essential


In this section you need to demonstrate that you have read the published person specification and how you meet the essential and (where relevant) desirable criteria for this particular post
Please include your reasons for applying and take the opportunity to highlight your particular talents and strengths, (what you feel you can personally offer - what is unique to you - what sets you apart from your peers).
Please DO NOT include personal details or duplicate information already provided elsewhere in your application.


Skills and Abilities Essential


In depth specialist knowledge of statistical data analysis and hypothesis testing on highly complex datasets.
Advanced level of Python, particularly in the development of machine learning applications.
An understanding of software principles such as APIs, Git, DevOps, CI/CD, and MLOps.


Location Essential


What is your current location? Please add which location you are applying for London hybrid or Home based.


Supporting statement (continued) Essential


Please continue your supporting statement in this section here.

Research and develop methodologies for the implementation of highly complex prediction and statistical models.

Contribute to model testing and development activities performed by the data science team and contribute to deploying data catalogue to create a consistent, managed pool of data assets.

Contribute to the development of statistical, mathematical and predictive modelling for such highly complex issues as claim value prediction.

Aid in the design of machine learning models to identify risk patterns to drive intelligently NHSR activity such as scenario modelling around risk and payout. Project length 3 years.

Assist in granular analysis of each stage of the claims lifecycle to drive changes in the claim processing, improve training, improve data quality and optimize NHSR resource allocation.

About Us

NHS Resolution is an Arms Length Body of the Department of Health & Social Care. As a not for profit part of the NHS, our purpose is to provide expertise to the NHS to resolve concerns fairly, share learning for improvement and preserve resources for patients. We have four key service areas:

  • Claims Management: delivering expertise in handling clinical and non-clinical claims to members of our Indemnity Schemes.
  • Practitioner Performance Advice: providing advice, support and interventions in relation to concerns about the individual performance of Doctors, Dentists and Pharmacists.
  • Primary Care Appeals: offering an impartial tribunal service for the fair handling of Primary Care contracting services.
  • Safety and Learning: supporting the NHS to better understand and learn from claims, concerns and disputes; to target safety activity while sharing learning across the NHS.

What do we have to offer?

At NHS Resolution, we strive to be an employer of choice. Some of the benefits we offer include access to the NHS Pension Scheme and a minimum of 27 days Annual Leave. We are also committed to support individuals in having a work and life balance, offering flexible working arrangements. Furthermore, we can offer a chance to gain extra skills and training and with regular reviews and a clear plan, all employees can develop to their full potential.

Job Description

Job responsibilities

Please ensure that you read the job description carefully and that you address each of the requirements of the post in the person specification in your supporting statement sections as your application will be assessed against these criteria. Your online application should relate to the specific position you are applying for and you are expected to highlight examples and achievements that demonstrate the competencies outlined in the job description and from the vacancy notice in your application form. Try to keep it structured and to the point.

Please note that we do not accept CVs, therefore your application must be via the NHS Jobs online application form. We have been granted permission to use the Employment Service's "Positive about Disabled People" symbol. Any applicant with a disability who meets the minimum specification for the post as set out in the person specification is guaranteed an interview.

We reserve the right to close the advert early should we receive sufficient applications

Please note: If you require a Visa to work in the UK, NHS Resolution is currently unable to support any sponsorship requests.

Person Specification

Notice Period Essential

  • What is your current notice period? Please add your notice length and comment if your notice period is negotiable.

Qualifications Essential

  • Educated to masters degree level or equivalent relevant experience.

Experience Essential

  • Ability to demonstrate significant experience within a similar area of work.
  • Considerable experience of using machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, classification, and NLP).
  • Experience in at least one cloud platform (preferably Azure) and associated machine learning services, e.g. Azure ML.

Supporting Statement Essential

  • In this section you need to demonstrate that you have read the published person specification and how you meet the essential and (where relevant) desirable criteria for this particular post
  • Please include your reasons for applying and take the opportunity to highlight your particular talents and strengths, (what you feel you can personally offer - what is unique to you - what sets you apart from your peers).
  • Please DO NOT include personal details or duplicate information already provided elsewhere in your application.

Skills and Abilities Essential

  • In depth specialist knowledge of statistical data analysis and hypothesis testing on highly complex datasets.
  • Advanced level of Python, particularly in the development of machine learning applications.
  • An understanding of software principles such as APIs, Git, DevOps, CI/CD, and MLOps.

Location Essential

  • What is your current location? Please add which location you are applying for London hybrid or Home based.

Supporting statement (continued) Essential

  • Please continue your supporting statement in this section here.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Junior Data Scientist

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £30k-£45k (DOE)




Are you passionate about data and finance? Join a revolutionary financial services company in the heart of London, where you'll help over 200,000 businesses across the UK and Europe navigate challenges and boost profitability.




My client is looking for a Junior Data Scientist eager to apply their analytical and modeling skills to provide insight and drive impactful business decisions.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse complex datasets: Work with large volumes of financial data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decisions.
Support predictive modeling: Collaborate on the development of machine learning models to forecast financial outcomes and optimise business processes.
Develop data-driven solutions: Create algorithms and tools that automate and enhance decision-making across the company.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with finance, product, and technology teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Visualise data insights: Build and maintain interactive dashboards and visualisations that provide clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field: Preferred disciplines include Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Proficiency in programming languages: Experience with Python and SQL for data analysis, manipulation, and modeling.
Basic understanding of machine learning: Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques and algorithms, in particular NLP, LLM's and Time Series Forecasting.
Experience with data visualization tools: Knowledge of tools like Tableau/Power BI, or similar to present data effectively.
Strong analytical skills: Ability to interpret complex data and communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience in finance: Prior exposure to financial data or working in a financial services environment is a plus.
Curiosity and drive: A passion for learning and staying updated with the latest trends in data science and finance.
Problem-solving mindset: Ability to think critically and approach challenges with innovative solutions.




The Benefits:

Growth opportunities: Be part of a fast-growing company with ample opportunities for career advancement.
Innovative work environment: Work with a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Cutting-edge tools and technologies: Access to the latest data science tools to help you excel in your role.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your skills and experience, along with performance-based bonuses.




If you’re a motivated Junior Data Scientist with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and be part of shaping the future of the finance industry.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Junior Data Scientist




About AIM Reply:

AIM Reply’s aspiration is to enable enterprises to leverage, industrialise, and monetise Artificial Intelligence capabilities for business transformation, growth, and value. The guiding mission is to establish a world-class boutique AI consulting and services firm. Brought together with a set of industry-focused offerings (Retail/FMCG; Manufacturing/Logistics and Financial Services/Insurance), dedicated partnerships with big tech companies, and a network of AI start-ups.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior data scientists and consultants to identify client needs and develop data-driven solutions
Collect, clean, and analyze large and complex datasets using statistical methods and machine learning techniques
Communicate findings and recommendations to clients through data visualizations and presentations
Work on multiple projects concurrently, managing time and prioritizing tasks effectively
Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with industry advancements in data science and related technologies
Assist in developing proposals and contributing to the growth of the AIM Reply

About the Candidate:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, or data science
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in statistical analysis and machine learning
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus
Ability to work in a team-oriented and client-focused environment

Reply provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type regardless of age, sexual orientation, gender, identity, pregnancy, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, disability, medical history, skin colour, marital status or parental status or any other characteristic protected by the Law.

Title: Data Scientist | AI
Description:
Data Scientist | AI Tech Scale-Up | London/Hybrid | Up to £50,000-£70,000 + Equity




We are excited to be working with a rapidly growing AI Tech Scale-Up looking to expand its team with a talented Data Scientist!




About the Company




This innovative company offers an advanced enterprise platform that delivers predictive analytics and provides actionable insights powered by AI. These insights drive real improvements in business performance for top-tier clients across sectors such as asset management, banking, retail, supply chain, telecoms, utilities, and more.




The Role




As a Data Scientist, you will be pivotal in developing AI-powered models and decision-making applications using their cutting-edge technology. You will work closely with a diverse team of researchers, engineers, and executives, collaborating directly with clients to address their most critical business challenges.




The Candidate:




Ideal candidates will have the following qualifications:




A minimum of 2 years of experience in a commercial data science role.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in industries such as Retail, Supply Chain, Financial Services, Telecoms, Public Sector, or similar.
Added bonus if some experience of working with LLM's

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Product Analytics team and play a key role in fulfilling our mission of being the # 1 choice for people to find love, friendship and community around the world.

At Bumble, Advanced Data Analytics functions as a core driver of business impact alongside engineering, product, and operations. We constantly seek opportunities, provide actionable insights, and navigate trade-offs.

The ideal candidate has extensive experience in Experimentation and Applied Statistics. They combine strong business acumen with a passion for building products customers love and a continuous desire to develop their craft.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Proactively identify opportunities and contribute insights that influence decision-making. 
Design metrics to provide structure and clarity for product and business teams.
Helping to evaluate trade-offs and measure the success of product efforts
Build and develop data products that drive clarity in understanding our members
Act as a subject matter expert in Experimentation and Causal Inference
Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions. This requires bringing a holistic view of the health of our ecosystem. 
Continuously push and adopt best practices across the advanced data analytics team





WHO YOU ARE:
You worked on digital consumer products before
You have experience with a wide range of analytical approaches, methodologies and frameworks
You are an excellent communication and collaboration skills. Experience using data to push forward product development
You have an ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
You have the dedication and commitment to developing your craft.
You have deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques, Python and data modelling
You have deep expertise in experimentation, A/B testing and causal inference
(bonus points) You have an understanding of multi-sided marketplace or the dating problem space

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.




Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with the engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
  • Generate actionable insights for business improvements


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • At least 1 - 2 years of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
  • Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
  • Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Tothemoon

Tothemoon is a user-centric, multiservice digital assets trading platform. At Tothemoon, we prioritize what matters most in finance: reliability. Whether it’s buying, selling, exchanging, or investing in cryptocurrencies, you can trust us to protect your financial interests and propel you towards a prosperous future. Join a rapidly growing community of users who choose Tothemoon for their digital transactions.

One of our products is a fast-growing, crypto-native investment fund focused entirely on DeFi. We see DeFi as a dynamic space with fewer competitive players, where traditional finance is slow to adapt due to regulatory constraints. This creates a unique opportunity to disrupt the market with innovative, AI-driven trading systems.

We’re on a mission to build the future of trading in DeFi by creating AI-driven systems that trade autonomously and scale with the market, reducing human involvement. Machine learning will be at the heart of our trading strategies, pushing the boundaries of quantitative research and providing smarter, more scalable solutions.

Note: No experience in trading or DeFi is required. We’re a tech company at our core and are looking for candidates with experience in fast-moving, data-driven environments.

What You’ll Do:

We’re seeking a Machine Learning Engineer with experience deploying pre-trained models, particularly reinforcement learning (RL) or other machine learning techniques, in production systems. Your background may include working with time series data in areas like forecasting traffic for social media, e-commerce, or similar fields.

In this role, you’ll deploy and optimize ML models for real-time trading systems. You’ll collaborate closely with our quantitative researchers to integrate these models into live environments, ensuring they scale effectively in the DeFi market. Your work will help drive the AI-powered trading strategies that will shape how we approach trading in DeFi.

Why Join Us?


Competitive salarythat reflects your value
Blended work– work from home or at our amazing office with the breathtaking sea view
Paid holidaysto relax and recharge
Opportunities forcontinuous learningandcareer growth
A dynamic, inclusive team that values creativity, humor, andout-of-the-boxthinking


We offer competitive compensation, with the possibility of profit-sharing based on your contributions to building and refining our trading strategies. As one of the first ML Engineers or ML Research Scientists to join the team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape our vision and share in the success as we grow.

At Tothemoon, we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we encourage you to bring your talents to the table. We assess candidates purely on their professional skills and experience.

Are you ready to help us shape the future of crypto? Apply today!

Powered by JazzHR
